meanings.definition: To enroll or enlist individuals for jury duty.
meanings.sent1: The judge will impanel a group of citizens to serve on the jury.
meanings.sent2: It is the court's responsibility to impanel a fair and impartial jury.
meanings.sent3: When the judge said he would impanel us for jury duty, I thought he was joking!
meanings.sent4: The task of impaneling a jury can sometimes be like assembling a puzzle of diverse perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The process of impaneling a jury ensures that justice is served through the collective wisdom of the community.

meanings.definition: To select or appoint individuals to serve on a jury.
meanings.sent1: The attorney will impanel the jurors for the upcoming trial.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to impanel a jury that represents a cross-section of society.
meanings.sent3: I never knew how challenging it could be to impanel a jury until I became a lawyer.
meanings.sent4: Impaneling a jury is like putting together a team of decision-makers for a legal game.
meanings.sent5: The judge's duty to impanel a jury is essential for upholding the principles of justice in our legal system.
